pubinfo.publish: Minnesota DNR - Division of Fish & Wildlife

descript.abstract: This is a polygon shapefile of sites managed for ruffed grouse by MN DNR (Department of Natural Resources); sometimes in cooperation with other public land management agencies. Ruffed Grouse Management Areas (RGMA) are managed to provide forest age-class diversity to provide excellent habitat for ruffed grouse, woodcock, and other early-successional wildlife species. These areas may or may not contain trails maintained to facilitate hunting. Off-highway vehicles generally are not allowed on RGMAs.
descript.purpose: To provide natural resource managers and the pubic with the locations of areas managed for ruffed grouse.

theme.themekey: wildlife, forest, habitat, ruffed grouse, hunting

idinfo.accconst: No special restrictions beyond those described in the Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement
idinfo.useconst: No special restrictions beyond those described in the Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement

cntperp.cntorg: Minnesota DNR - Division of Fish & Wildlife - Wildlife Unit

dataqual.logic: Data are topologically correct using ArcView 3.x. All polygons are closed and lines intersect where intended.
dataqual.complete: This coverage is not complete. These data are updated by the Wildlife Administrative areas, as needed.

procstep.procdesc:
Attribute Lineage for source table BDRY_ADWMAPY3.DBF: See "Wildlife Management Area/Geographic Information System Project Standards Version 1.3" rgmaply2_01082013
Source Scale: 24000

attracc.attraccr: Source table BDRY_ADWMAPY3.DBF: The names of WMAs have been identified accurately. Other attributes have varying levels of accuracy.

distinfo.distliab: The Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement is online: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/sitetools/data_software_license.html
